00001 /* 
00002  * jcom.in~
00003  * External for Jamoma: manage audio inputs for a module
00004  * By Tim Place, Copyright © 2006
00005  * 
00006  * License: This code is licensed under the terms of the GNU LGPL
00007  * http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html

00009 
00010 
00011 /*
00012         The user specifies @channel_config mono or @channel_config stereo 
00013         as arg to the module.  That makes the hub responsible for cleaning
00014         up any unused inlets and outlets for the configuration.  
00015         
00016         It may also signal to the module to handle the poly differently,
00017         i.e. if the algorithm should be true stereo instead of multi-mono
00018         
00019         This all means that we need this object to subscribe to the hub.
00020 */
00021 
00022 #include "Jamoma.h"
00023 #include "jcom.in.h"
00024 
00025 // Globals
00026 t_class         *in_class;                                      // Required. Global pointing to this class
00027 t_atom          ga_zero;
00028 
00029 
00030 /************************************************************************************/
00031 // Main() Function
00032 
00033 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00034 {
00035         long            attrflags = 0;
00036         t_class         *c;
00037         t_object        *attr;
00038         long            offset;
00039         
00040         jamoma_init();
00041 
00042         // Define our class
00043 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00044         c = class_new("jcom.in~",(method)in_new, (method)in_free, (short)sizeof(t_in), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00045 #else
00046         c = class_new("jcom.in",(method)in_new, (method)in_free, (short)sizeof(t_in), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00047 #endif
00048 
00049         offset = calcoffset(t_in, common);
00050         class_obexoffset_set(c, offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, obex));
00051 
00052         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00053         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_dispatched,                       "dispatched",                   A_GIMME, 0L);
00054         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_algorithm_message,        "algorithm_message",    A_GIMME, 0L);
00055         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_view_internals,           "open",                                 A_GIMME, 0L);   // method used to view algorithm
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_link,                                     "link_out",                             A_CANT, 0L);    // maybe used to forward messages in jmod.in
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_unlink,                           "unlink_out",                   0L);
00058 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00059         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_dsp,                                      "dsp",                                  A_GIMME, 0L);
00060         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_remoteaudio,                      "remoteaudio",                  A_CANT, 0);
00061 #else
00062         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_bang,                                     "bang",                                 0L);
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_int,                                      "int",                                  A_LONG, 0L);
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_float,                            "float",                                A_FLOAT, 0L);
00065         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_anything,                         "list",                                 A_GIMME, 0L);
00066         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_anything,                         "anything",                             A_GIMME, 0L);   
00067 #endif
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)in_release,                          "release",                              A_CANT, 0L);    // notification of hub being freed
00069     class_addmethod(c, (method)in_assist,                               "assist",                               A_CANT, 0L);
00070 
00071         jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_common(c, attr, offset); 
00072         
00073         // ATTRIBUTE: algorithm_type
00074         attr = attr_offset_new("algorithm_type", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00075                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_in, attr_algorithm_type));
00076         class_addattr(c, attr);
00077         
00078         // ATTRIBUTE: num_inputs
00079         attr = attr_offset_new("num_inputs", _sym_long, attrflags,
00080                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_in, num_inputs));
00081         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00082 
00083 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00084 //      // ATTRIBUTE: manage_channels
00085 //      attr = attr_offset_new("manage_channels", _sym_long, attrflags,
00086 //              (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_in, attr_manage_channels));
00087 //      class_addattr(c, attr);
00088         
00089         // Setup our class to work with MSP
00090         class_dspinit(c);
00091 #endif
00092 
00093         // Finalize our class
00094         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00095         in_class = c;
00096 
00097         atom_setlong(&ga_zero, 0);
00098         return 0;
00099 }

00102 /************************************************************************************/
00103 // Object Life
00104 
00105 // Create
00106 void *in_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00107 {
00108         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);               // support normal arguments
00109         t_in            *x = (t_in *)object_alloc(in_class);
00110         short           i;
00111                 
00112         if(x){
00113                 x->dumpout = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00114                 x->algout = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00115                 
00116                 object_obex_store((void *)x, ps_dumpout, (object *)x->dumpout);         // setup the dumpout
00117 
00118                 x->num_inputs = 0;
00119                 x->attr_algorithm_type = _sym_nothing;
00120                 x->attr_bypass = 0;
00121                 x->attr_mute = 0;
00122                 x->attr_freeze = 0;
00123                 x->vector_size = 0;  // reset cached vector size
00124 
00125                 if(attrstart > 0){
00126                         int argument = atom_getlong(argv);
00127                         x->num_inputs = tt_audio_base::clip(argument, 0, MAX_NUM_CHANNELS);
00128                 } 
00129                 else
00130                         x->outlet[0] = x->algout;  // no arguments send any input out the first outlet
00131 
00132 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00133                 if(x->num_inputs > 0)
00134                         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, x->num_inputs);              // Create Object and Inlets
00135                 else
00136                         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, 1);                                  // Create Object and Inlet
00137 
00138                 x->common.ob.z_misc = Z_NO_INPLACE | Z_PUT_FIRST;
00139                 
00140                 for(i=0; i < (x->num_inputs); i++)
00141                         outlet_new((t_pxobject *)x, "signal");                  // Create a signal outlet               
00142                 for(i=0; i < MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++){
00143                         x->signal_in[i] = new tt_audio_signal;                  // Storage for the signal (accessed by jcom.out~)
00144                         x->remote_vectors[i] = NULL;
00145                 }
00146                 in_alloc(x, sys_getblksize());                                          // allocates the vectors for the audio signals
00147 #else
00148                 for(i = x->num_inputs-1; i >= 1; i--)
00149                         x->inlet[i] = proxy_new(x, i, 0L);
00150                 for(i = x->num_inputs-1; i >= 0; i--)
00151                         x->outlet[i] = outlet_new(x, 0L);
00152 
00153 #endif
00154                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_common(&x->common, ps__jcom_in__, ps_subscribe_in);
00155                 jcom_core_subscriber_setcustomsubscribe_method(&x->common, &in_subscribe);
00156                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                                       // handle attribute args                                
00157                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00158         }
00159         return (x);                                                                                             // Return the pointer
00160 }
00161 
00162 
00163 // deferred function for registering with the jcom.hub object
00164 void in_subscribe(void *z)
00165 {
00166         long            argc;
00167         t_atom          a;
00168         t_atom          *argv = &a;
00169         t_symbol        *result;
00170         t_symbol        *modtype;
00171         t_in            *x = (t_in *)z;
00172         
00173         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00174                 // Find out what type of algorithm this is supposed to control
00175                 object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_algorithm_type, &argc, &argv);
00176                 result = atom_getsym(argv);
00177                 if(result == ps_default){
00178                         object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_module_type, &argc, &argv);
00179                         modtype = atom_getsym(argv);
00180                         
00181                         if(modtype == ps_audio)
00182                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_poly;
00183                         else if(modtype == ps_video)
00184                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_jitter;
00185                         else
00186                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_control;
00187                 }
00188                 else
00189                         x->attr_algorithm_type = result;
00190         }
00191 }
00192 
00193 
00194 // Destroy
00195 void in_free(t_in *x)
00196 {
00197 #ifdef JCOM_IN_TILDE
00198         short i;
00199         
00200         dsp_free((t_pxobject *)x);                      // Always call dsp_free first in this routine
00201         for(i=0; i < MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++)
00202                 delete x->signal_in[i];
00203 #endif
00204         jcom_core_subscriber_common_free(&x->common);
00205 }
00206 
00207 
00208 // Notification that the hub no longer exists
00209 void in_release(t_in *x)
00210 {
00211         jcom_core_subscriber_hubrelease(&x->common);
00212         x->out_object = NULL;
00213 }

00216 /************************************************************************************/
00217 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00218 
00219 // Method for Assistance Messages
00220 void in_assist(t_in *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00221 {
00222         if(msg==1)      // Inlets
00223                 strcpy(dst, "(signal) input to the module");
00224         else if(msg==2){ // Outlets
00225                 if(arg < x->num_inputs) 
00226                         strcpy(dst, "(signal) connect to the algorithm");
00227                 else if(arg == x->num_inputs) 
00228                         strcpy(dst, "connect to algorithm");
00229                 else 
00230                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00231         }
00232 }
00233 
00234 
00235 // messages received from jcom.hub for the algorithm
00236 void in_algorithm_message(t_in *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00237 {
00238         char            namestring[256];
00239         t_symbol        *osc;
00240 
00241         if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_mute) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_mute)){
00242                 x->attr_mute = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00243                 outlet_anything(x->algout, ps_mute, argc-1, argv+1);
00244         }
00245         else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_video_mute) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_video_mute))
00246                 x->attr_mute = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00247         else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_video_bypass) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_video_bypass))
00248                 x->attr_bypass = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00249         else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_video_freeze) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_video_freeze))
00250                 x->attr_freeze = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00251         
00252         strcpy(namestring, "/");                                                // perhaps we could optimize this operation
00253         strcat(namestring, argv->a_w.w_sym->s_name);    //      by creating a table when the param is bound
00254         osc = gensym(namestring);                                               //      then we could look-up the symbol instead of using gensym()
00255 
00256         outlet_anything(x->algout, osc, argc-1, argv+1);
00257 }
00258

00260 void in_view_internals(t_in *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00261 {
00262         outlet_anything(x->algout, ps_open, 0, 0L);
00263 }

00268 {
00269         ;
00270 }

00273 // set pointer to the out object so we can forward messages to it 
00274 void in_link(t_in *x, t_object *y)
00275 {
00276         x->out_object = y;
00277 }

00280 void in_unlink(t_in *x)
00281 {
00282         x->out_object = NULL;
00283 }

00285 
00286 void in_bang(t_in *x)
00287 {
00288         if(x->attr_mute)
00289                 ;
00290         else if(x->attr_freeze)
00291                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendlastvalue);
00292         else if(x->attr_bypass)
00293                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendbypassedvalue, proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x), _sym_bang, 0, NULL);
00294         else
00295                 outlet_bang(x->outlet[proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x)]);
00296 }
00297 
00298 
00299 void in_int(t_in *x, long value)
00300 {
00301         if(x->attr_mute)
00302                 ;
00303         else if(x->attr_freeze)
00304                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendlastvalue);
00305         else if(x->attr_bypass){
00306                 t_atom a;
00307                 atom_setlong(&a, value);
00308                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendbypassedvalue, proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x), _sym_int, 1, &a);
00309         }
00310         else
00311                 outlet_int(x->outlet[proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x)], value);
00312 }
00313 
00314 
00315 void in_float(t_in *x, double value)
00316 {
00317         if(x->attr_mute)
00318                 ;
00319         else if(x->attr_freeze)
00320                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendlastvalue);
00321         else if(x->attr_bypass){
00322                 t_atom a;
00323                 atom_setfloat(&a, value);
00324                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendbypassedvalue, proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x), _sym_float, 1, &a);
00325         }
00326         else
00327                 outlet_float(x->outlet[proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x)], value);
00328 }

00330 
00331 void in_anything(t_in *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00332 {
00333         if(x->attr_mute)
00334                 ;
00335         else if(x->attr_freeze)
00336                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendlastvalue);
00337         else if(x->attr_bypass)
00338                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_sendbypassedvalue, proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x), msg, argc, argv);
00339         else
00340                 outlet_anything(x->outlet[proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x)], msg, argc, argv);
00341 }

00343 
00344 // Perform Method - just pass the whole vector straight through
00345 // (the work is all done in the dsp method)
00346 t_int *in_perform(t_int *w)
00347 {
00348         t_in    *x = (t_in *)(w[1]);            // Instance
00349         short   n;
00350         short   chan = x->num_inputs;
00351         short   i, j;
00352         float   *out, *remote;
00353         
00354         for(i=0; i < chan; i++){
00355                 n = x->vector_size;
00356                 remote = x->remote_vectors[i];
00357                 out = x->out_vectors[i];
00358                 j = 0;
00359                 if(out && x->signal_in[i]->vector){
00360                         if(remote){
00361                                 while(n--){
00362                                         x->signal_in[i]->vector[j] += *remote;
00363                                         *out++ = x->signal_in[i]->vector[j];
00364                                         *remote = 0.0;
00365                                         remote++;
00366                                         j++;
00367                                 } 
00368                         }
00369                         else{
00370                                 while(n--){
00371                                         *out++ = x->signal_in[i]->vector[j];
00372                                         j++;
00373                                 } 
00374                         }
00375                 }
00376         }
00377         return(w+2);
00378 }

00380 
00381 // TODO: We are not guaranteed that this will be called after in_perform, right?
00382 // If that is so then our mixing is bogus, and perform needs to perform mixing too...
00383 void in_remoteaudio(t_in *x, float *audioVectors[], long numAudioVectors)
00384 {
00385         short   i;
00386         float   *vector, *out;
00387         long    n;
00388         
00389         for(i=0; i<numAudioVectors; i++){
00390                 vector = audioVectors[i];
00391                 n = x->vector_size;
00392                 out = x->remote_vectors[i];
00393                 while(n--)
00394                         *out++ += *vector++;
00395         }
00396 }
00397 
00398 
00399 // DSP Method
00400 void in_dsp(t_in *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00401 {
00402         short   i, j;
00403 
00404         in_alloc(x, sp[0]->s_n);                // Vector Size
00405 
00406         for(i=0; i < x->num_inputs; i++){       //take a look at each
00407                 if(count[i])
00408                         x->signal_in[i]->set_vector(sp[i]->s_vec);
00409                 else
00410                         x->signal_in[i]->set_vector(NULL);
00411         }
00412         
00413         j=i;
00414         for(i=0; i < x->num_inputs; i++, j++){
00415                 if(count[i])
00416                         x->out_vectors[i] = sp[j]->s_vec;
00417                 else
00418                         x->out_vectors[i] = NULL;
00419         }
00420         dsp_add(in_perform, 1, x);
00421 }
00422 
00423 
00424 void in_alloc(t_in *x, int vector_size)
00425 {
00426         short i;
00427         
00428         if(vector_size != x->vector_size) {
00429                 x->vector_size = vector_size;
00430                 for(i=0; i < MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++){
00431                         x->signal_in[i]->alloc(vector_size);
00432                         if(x->remote_vectors[i])
00433                                 sysmem_freeptr(x->remote_vectors[i]);
00434                         x->remote_vectors[i] = (float*)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(float) * x->vector_size);
00435                 }
00436         }
00437 }
